intro: Pelexia matucanensis, commonly known as the Matucanensis pelexia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, triangular leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
